title: Luna Park

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on board.

publication_history:
Irving Sandler and William Berkson, Alex Katz, exh. cat. (New York: Praeger Publishing, 1971), 117, cat .9 (ill.).

Richard Marshal, with an essay by Robert Rosenblum, Alex Katz, exh. cat. (New York: Whitney Musuem of American Art, 1986), 68, pl. 8 (color ill.), 152.

Michael Scholnick, Alex Katz from the Early 60s, exh. cat. (New York: Robert Miller Gallery, 1987), n.p. (color ill.).

Jochen Poetter, ed. with essays by Robert Storr and Margrit Brehm, Alex Katz: American Landscape, exh. cat. (Stuttgart: Oktagon Verlag, 1995), 73, cat. 8 (color ill.).

Kunst und Ausstellungshalle der Bundesrepublik Deutschland, Alex Katz: In Your Face, exh. cat. (Cologne: Wienand, 2002), 10, 11,17, 31 (color ill.), 137.

William A. Farnsworth Library and Museum, Alex Katz in Maine, exh. cat. (Milan: Edition Charta, 2005), 27 (color ill.), 104.

Barry Schwabsky, Alex Katz: The Sixties, exh. cat. (New York: PaceWildenstein. 2006), 15, 24, 25 (color ill.), 80.

Sylvia C. Weber, Alex Katz: Prints, Paintings, Cutouts, exh. cat. (Künzelsau: Swiridoff, 2010), 21 (color ill.), 26, 27 (color ill.), 86.

Matrin Clark, Alison M. Gingeras, and Sarah Martin, Alex Katz: Give Me Tomorrow, exh. cat. (London: Tate St Ives, Margate: Turner Contemporary, 2012), 44, 45, cat. 12 (color ill.), 117.

Grainne Sweeney, Alex Katz: Beneath the Surface, exh. cat. (Middlesbrough: Middlesbrough Institute of Modern Art, 2013), 86, 87 (color ill.).

Roberta Smith, “One Painter’s Progress, Unfurled on a Spiral,” New York Times, Oct. 21, 2022, C1, C14–15.

Katherine Brinson and Levi Prombaum, eds., with contributions by David Breslin, Jennifer Y. Chuong, David Max Horowitz, Arthur Jafa, Katie M. Kitamura, Wayne Koestenbaum, Ewa Lajer-Burcharth, Kevin Lotery, and Prudence Peiffer, Alex Katz: Gathering, exh. cat. (New York: Guggenheim Museum, 2022), 113, cat. 54 (color ill.).
exhibition_history:
Salt Lake City, Utah Museum of Fine Arts, Alex Katz, Jan. 7–Feb. 7, 1971, cat. 9.; San Diego, University of California, Feb 24–Apr. 14, 1971; St. Paul, Minnesota Museum of Art, July 26–Oct. 3, 1971; Hartford, Wadsworth Atheneum, Nov. 1–Dec. 21, 1971.

New York, Whitney Museum of American Art, Alex Katz Retrospective, Mar. 13–June 15, 1986, cat. 41. 

New York, Robert Miller Gallery, Alex Katz from the Early 60s, Oct. 6–31, 1987, no cat. no. 

Baden-Baden, Germany, Staatlich Kunsthalle, Alex Katz: American Landscape, Oct. 15–Dec. 3, 1995, cat. 8

Baltimore Museum of Art, Alex Katz Under the Stars: American Landscapes 1951-1995, June 12–Sept. 8, 1996, no cat. no.; West Palm Beach, Norton Museum of Art, Mar. 15–May 3, 1997; Portland Museum of Art, July 19–Sept. 14; New York, P.S.1 Contemporary Art Center, Apr. 26–June 21, 1998. 

Bonn, Germany, Kunst- und Ausstellungshalle der Bundesrepublik Deutschland, Alex Katz: In Your Face, May 9–Aug. 18, 2002, no cat. no.

Rockland, ME, Farnsworth Art Museum, Alex Katz in Maine, July 2–Oct. 16, 2005, no cat. no.

New York, Pace Wildenstein, Alex Katz: The Sixties, Apr. 27– June 17, 2006, no cat. no.

Schwabisch Hall, Germany, Kunsthalle Wurth, Alex Katz: Prints, Paintings, Cutouts, Oct. 5, 2010–Apr. 3, 2011, no. cat. no. 

Tate St. Ives, Alex Katz: Give Me Tomorrow, May 19, 2012–Sept. 23, 2012, cat. 12, Margate, Turner Contemporary, Oct. 6, 2012-Jan. 13, 2013.

Middlesbrough Institute of Modern Art, July 19, 2013–Oct. 13, 2013, no cat. no. 

New York, Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, Alex Katz: Gathering, Oct. 21, 2022–Feb. 20, 2023, cat. 54.
provenance_text: The artist; given to the Art Insitute of Chicago, September 15, 2020
